definition: old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
perpetual calendar/ten thousand year calendar/Islamic calendar introduced to Yuan China by Jamal al-Din 紮馬剌丁|扎马剌丁
old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]

sentences.english: Weekly calendar is very important because it tells your bosses their arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 周曆非常重要，因爲它將告訴你的老闆具體的安排。

sentences.english: The words on the tablet are a precious resource for studying the history of the country.
sentences.chinese: 碣上的文字是研究祖國曆史的寶貴資料。

sentences.english: Thursday's robbery was among the biggest heists in British history.
sentences.chinese: 週四的搶劫案是英國曆史上搶劫價值最大的。

sentences.english: We trace the evolution of an eleven-year-old boy in the Midwest, Jack, one of three brothers.
sentences.chinese: 影片講述的是美國中西部一個11歲男孩的成長曆程。

sentences.english: He was a french historian and pedagogue.
sentences.chinese: 他是法國曆史學家和教育家。

sentences.english: Jose Flores says his children love to study American history at school.
sentences.chinese: 何塞弗洛雷斯說，他的孩子喜歡在學校學習美國曆史。

sentences.english: The age of Mill constitutes a natural epoch in English History.
sentences.chinese: 密勒的時代在英國曆史上形成了一個自然的新時代。

sentences.english: The vicissitudes, the wind and rain is rough, the great motherland experiences the tribulation.
sentences.chinese: 滄海桑田，風雨坎坷，偉大的祖國曆盡磨難。

sentences.english: Lies exposes seamy aspects of the U.S. past.
sentences.chinese: 《老師的謊言》一書揭示了美國曆史中黑暗的一面。

sentences.english: His self-confidence and competent manner, as is the case in U. S. history.
sentences.chinese: 他舉止幹練而自信，實爲美國曆史之事件。

sentences.english: The Cardiff Giant is one of the most famous hoaxes in American history.
sentences.chinese: 卡蒂夫巨人是美國曆史上最有名的騙局之一。

sentences.english: Chao is the first Chinese person to hold a position in the US cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 趙曉蘭是美國曆史上首位進入內閣的華裔。

sentences.english: After eighty adventurous experiences, Tang Sanzang finally got the real Buddhist scripture.
sentences.chinese: 唐三藏曆經九九八十一難終於取得了真經。

sentences.english: This is a significant moment in our history.
sentences.chinese: 這是美國曆史上的一個重大時刻。

sentences.english: Nineteen-sixty-eight was a particularly difficult year in U.S. history.
sentences.chinese: 1968年是美國曆史上尤爲艱難的一年。

sentences.english: One of the most famous Mint errors in the United States occurred in 1922.
sentences.chinese: 美國曆史上最大的錯印事故發生在1922年。

definition: the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
